intro: Doxantha uncata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Doxantha uncata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
